schema:name: Long-term changes in the mean maximum length of pelagic fish communities in UK waters and surrounding areas, 1983 to 2016

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Species composition in fish communities (mean maximum length)

schema:author.schema:name: Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea

schema:spatialCoverage: UK (Celtic Seas and Greater North Sea)
notes:
The assessment period differs depending on the survey, starting at the earliest in 1983 in one Greater North Sea subdivision and ending in either 2015 or 2016.

1. Long-term increase: the fish are shifting back towards larger species
2. No long-term change: no change in the composition of fish communities
3. Long-term decrease: more smaller species than in an earlier period but less than in a more recent one
4. Decrease to minimum observed state: the community has the highest proportion of small species recorded
